dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Dickwella b NLTC Perera 94 (70b 17x4 1x6 92m) SR: 134.28

dismissalComment.html: taken by Dickwella! QDK gets a leading edge looking to whip a horrible delivery down leg side. Wants to get it over short fine but closes the face too early. Goes high and right on top of Dickwella. Simple take. Was shaping to be a memorable hundred, cut short tamely

dismissalComment.html: sensational diving catch from Rajitha! Bouncer outside off. Looks to hook but he's on the front foot. It's rising as he plays and he gets a top edge that is dipping rapidly as Rajitha runs in deep square. Keeps his eyes on it, gets low and lunges forward to hold on. Superb

dismissalText.commentary: Andile Phehlukwayo c WIA Fernando b de Silva 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: sliced to point! Phehlukwayo backed away a little, slashing hard at a full, wide one. I'm not sure if he's looking to cut or to drive, but he ends up spooning a high catch to a back-peddling Fernando at point. A bit of a nothing shot, really

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller st Dickwella b de Silva 25 (36b 1x4 0x6 53m) SR: 69.44

dismissalComment.html: Miller runs past one! He was down the track again, but not to the pitch, and the ball from de Silva gripped and spun past him as he groped at it. Dickwella has the bails off in a flash, and South Africa slip further from what was a great position

dismissalText.commentary: Lungi Ngidi st Dickwella b Dananjaya 6 (11b 0x4 0x6 23m) SR: 54.54

dismissalComment.html: stumping appeal sent upstairs. This could be close...it looks out in fact. Overpitched legbreak outside off, looks to go against the turn and slog this. It looks like the curve of his boot has kept him ON the line rather than behind it. Yes. He's out

dismissalText.commentary: Oshada Fernando lbw b Nortje 31 (45b 3x4 0x6 69m) SR: 68.88

dismissalComment.html: a huge appeal for lbw and given by Shaun George! Oshada sends it upstairs immediately though. Length ball on the stumps and angling on to the pads, Oshada misses the flick and is hit on the pads. The front foot is fine. The ball pitched outside off, the impact is in front of middle and leg but it would have gone on to just clip the top of the leg stump. The umpire's call it is and that was out. Sri Lanka are five down now

headshotImage.longCaption: Anrich Nortje player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis run out (Nortje) 24 (31b 2x4 0x6 41m) SR: 77.41

dismissalComment.html: confusion, run-out chance, direct hit! Great work from Nortje at short third man! Mendis is the man running to the danger end but Oshada is never convinced. Worse. He's taken a couple of steps down the track and then just stops. That means Mends has run halfway down the pitch. Then he stops. Seeing Mendis has run halfway down the pitch Oshada accepts the single but by that time the damage is done. Nortje picks the ball up, throws the stumps at the strikers end down and Sri Lanka lose a big one. Mendis actually threw his bat away in pure frustration at that horrible turn of events (Oh and before I forget, the ball was shortish and outside off, Oshada played a deft little dab)

headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: that's the 100th ODI wicket for Rabada! Short of length this time aimed at the body, Dickwella gives himself some room and looks to pull it away, gets a top edge that skies towards the keeper, de Kock pedals back and takes it near his chest before falling backwards

headshotImage.caption: Dhananjaya de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dhananjaya de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: a soft dismissal, chipped to short midwicket, it was fuller on the stumps, Dhananjaya plays a half shot, fails to keep it down and du Plessis accepts a dolly

headshotImage.caption: Akila Dananjaya
headshotImage.longCaption: Akila Dananjaya

dismissalComment.html: taken by midwicket running to his right! It is quick. It is short. It cramps the left-hander and even though he tries to make room, he mistimes the shot, a pull that comes off with the bat still turning in his hands. That means he gets no power behind the ball and South Africa are all set to ride out into the sunset

headshotImage.caption: Avishka Fernando  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Avishka Fernando  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bowled'im! Crashed into the off stump! Length outside off, nips back, Fernando went for another pull but misses it altogether this time. Sri Lanka have lost both their openers now

headshotImage.caption: SL Malinga headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: SL Malinga headshot

dismissalComment.html: backs away and swats the short ball outside off straight to the substitute fielder Dale Steyn at cover point. Yep, Dale Steyn's a substitute fielder. And also, South Africa have won, despite putting up only 250 on the board

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Miller b Nortje 8 (23b 0x4 0x6 35m) SR: 34.78

dismissalComment.html: strikes first ball! And the Durban hero falls! Kusal Perera, the man who defied South Africa in the most epic manner not too long ago, is taken out by a ball measured at 145 kph on the speedgun. And yet it seems as if his undoing is because he is too early into the shot. The ball - back of a length on leg stump - seems to stick in the pitch and the left-hander, looking to flick it over midwicket, only ends up top-edging towards point where Miller runs in, dives forward and takes a splendid catch

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga c sub (DW Steyn) b Ngidi 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 25

commentTextItems.html: backs away and swats the short ball outside off straight to the substitute fielder Dale Steyn at cover point. Yep, Dale Steyn's a substitute fielder. And also, South Africa have won, despite putting up only 250 on the board

commentPostTextItems.html: That's all we have for you, thanks, as ever, for your company and goodnight!

"I suppose from a perfect game, after the start we had with the bat, we probably wanted 30 or 40 more runs. But the way we responded with the ball and the field is exactly what we want. Sometimes we need our bowlers to get you out of trouble and that's what the three fast bowlers did. Beautiful to see," Faf du Plessis says. "Lungi, you don't look at him and see he bowls 147. But he hits the ball hard and he always picks up wickets in the ifrst five overs and that's a massive weapon. Nortje has a huge tank, to bowl seven overs in a row. Good to see him bowling with pace and control. Good signs. Probably bout a year or two ago, I wanted to transition from a good player to try and become a great player so challenged myself mentally that when I get to 30s and 40s, I want to make big runs. And that mental shift is really the difference. For us the Vision is just to look ahead, doesn't always make sense, Mulder batting at 5 today, no one would have expected, but that's what we want to do. Its good that we're 2-0 up, it gives us that flexibility and to make out of the box moves. Someone like JP has to come back. We have to fix that. If he comes back it might change one or two other things. Obviously Dale will be back for the last two games. Hopefully we can get our top six batters, an allrounder and four bowlers for the World Cup"

Quinton de Kock is Man of the Match"I didn't mean to be [hitting all those boundaries] The wicket played really nicely up front. It's nice to get the team off to a good start like that. Every time we play cricket, we want to play the ball not the name, half-volley's a half volley after all. KG came out there with great intent. It's the fastest he's bowled in a while. Good to see him cranking up those speeds. [On Miller keeping] He seemed pretty excited. We are working on him. We'll make him a better keeper one day"

Presentation time "I think, first 10-15 overs we were not bowling well but after that we hung in there and then we restricted them to 250 which was a really good effort." Lasith Malinga says. "I think they didn't understand, I feel this is not a gift. They have talent. That's why they're playing fo rthe national team. They have to understand that. They have to understand their own value. We have done enough talking. Players have to realise they have to value these opportunity. They don't come around every day. They have to grab it."

UJack: "SL lost its last 5 wickets for 33, while SA lost the last 5 for 31. Top order performance made the difference. All the more reason QdK deserves to be MoM tonight. SL need to focus on their limited over batting urgently!"
ShaileshR: "SA have won by a whopping 113 runs, despite putting only 250 on board." ---- And that single sentence alone is about as emphatic as any high-brow analysis

7.41 pm South Africa were 220 for 4. Then they were 250 all out. That after Quinton de Kock's outrageous 94 off only 70 balls, with practically all those runs made in boundaries. The pitch really didn't look that easy to bat on. And Sri Lanka showed that to be true in the final stages of the first innings

But South Africa's bowlers and fielders were on it from ball one. There were yells of "one brings two" as Faf du Plessis set loose his fast bowlers. Kagiso Rabada and Lungi Ngidi responded, bowling 150 kph and setting the tone at the very start. The only batsmen that managed to offer any resistance was Kusal Mendis and Oshada Fernando. Both of them looked more than capable of winning this game but both of them were dimissed by Anrich Nortje, running one of them out and trapping the other lbw. Great game for the newly-capped fast bowler. And at 116 for 5, Imran Tahir came in, took over, and ushered the game to its current conclusion.
Adarsh: "Never thought I would see the words "substitute fielder Dale Steyn"."

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Dickwella b NLTC Perera 94 (70b 17x4 1x6 92m) SR: 134.28

dismissalComment.html: taken by Dickwella! QDK gets a leading edge looking to whip a horrible delivery down leg side. Wants to get it over short fine but closes the face too early. Goes high and right on top of Dickwella. Simple take. Was shaping to be a memorable hundred, cut short tamely

dismissalText.commentary: Rassie van der Dussen c Rajitha b NLTC Perera 2 (4b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: sensational diving catch from Rajitha! Bouncer outside off. Looks to hook but he's on the front foot. It's rising as he plays and he gets a top edge that is dipping rapidly as Rajitha runs in deep square. Keeps his eyes on it, gets low and lunges forward to hold on. Superb

headshotImage.caption: DA Miller headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: DA Miller headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Miller b Nortje 8 (23b 0x4 0x6 35m) SR: 34.78

dismissalComment.html: strikes first ball! And the Durban hero falls! Kusal Perera, the man who defied South Africa in the most epic manner not too long ago, is taken out by a ball measured at 145 kph on the speedgun. And yet it seems as if his undoing is because he is too early into the shot. The ball - back of a length on leg stump - seems to stick in the pitch and the left-hander, looking to flick it over midwicket, only ends up top-edging towards point where Miller runs in, dives forward and takes a splendid catch

headshotImage.longCaption: Anrich Nortje player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Oshada Fernando lbw b Nortje 31 (45b 3x4 0x6 69m) SR: 68.88

dismissalComment.html: a huge appeal for lbw and given by Shaun George! Oshada sends it upstairs immediately though. Length ball on the stumps and angling on to the pads, Oshada misses the flick and is hit on the pads. The front foot is fine. The ball pitched outside off, the impact is in front of middle and leg but it would have gone on to just clip the top of the leg stump. The umpire's call it is and that was out. Sri Lanka are five down now

headshotImage.caption: Anrich Nortje player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Anrich Nortje player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis run out (Nortje) 24 (31b 2x4 0x6 41m) SR: 77.41

dismissalComment.html: confusion, run-out chance, direct hit! Great work from Nortje at short third man! Mendis is the man running to the danger end but Oshada is never convinced. Worse. He's taken a couple of steps down the track and then just stops. That means Mends has run halfway down the pitch. Then he stops. Seeing Mendis has run halfway down the pitch Oshada accepts the single but by that time the damage is done. Nortje picks the ball up, throws the stumps at the strikers end down and Sri Lanka lose a big one. Mendis actually threw his bat away in pure frustration at that horrible turn of events (Oh and before I forget, the ball was shortish and outside off, Oshada played a deft little dab)

dismissalText.commentary: Akila Dananjaya c Mulder b Rabada 4 (16b 0x4 0x6 23m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: taken by midwicket running to his right! It is quick. It is short. It cramps the left-hander and even though he tries to make room, he mistimes the shot, a pull that comes off with the bat still turning in his hands. That means he gets no power behind the ball and South Africa are all set to ride out into the sunset

headshotImage.longCaption: Imran Tahir headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Kasun Rajitha lbw b Imran Tahir 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: traps him lbw! Tahir's sprinted all the way to point. Didn't even bother to look at the umpire. His finger's up though. And this is special. This is Tahir's trademark. The quicker delivery. The googly. Pitching on off stump. Cutting back into the batsman - a batsman who thinks this will be a leg break and so he can go back and cut. "Well, boo!" says the ball as it cuts in and strikes low on the back pad in front of the sticks

The ball - back of a length on leg stump - seems to stick in the pitch and the left-hander, looking to flick it over midwicket, only ends up top-edging towards point where Miller runs in, dives forward and takes a splendid catch

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis run out (Nortje) 24 (31b 2x4 0x6 41m) SR: 77.41

dismissalComment.html: confusion, run-out chance, direct hit! Great work from Nortje at short third man! Mendis is the man running to the danger end but Oshada is never convinced. Worse. He's taken a couple of steps down the track and then just stops. That means Mends has run halfway down the pitch. Then he stops. Seeing Mendis has run halfway down the pitch Oshada accepts the single but by that time the damage is done. Nortje picks the ball up, throws the stumps at the strikers end down and Sri Lanka lose a big one. Mendis actually threw his bat away in pure frustration at that horrible turn of events (Oh and before I forget, the ball was shortish and outside off, Oshada played a deft little dab)

dismissalText.commentary: Oshada Fernando lbw b Nortje 31 (45b 3x4 0x6 69m) SR: 68.88

dismissalComment.html: a huge appeal for lbw and given by Shaun George! Oshada sends it upstairs immediately though. Length ball on the stumps and angling on to the pads, Oshada misses the flick and is hit on the pads. The front foot is fine. The ball pitched outside off, the impact is in front of middle and leg but it would have gone on to just clip the top of the leg stump. The umpire's call it is and that was out. Sri Lanka are five down now

dismissalText.commentary: Kasun Rajitha lbw b Imran Tahir 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: traps him lbw! Tahir's sprinted all the way to point. Didn't even bother to look at the umpire. His finger's up though. And this is special. This is Tahir's trademark. The quicker delivery. The googly. Pitching on off stump. Cutting back into the batsman - a batsman who thinks this will be a leg break and so he can go back and cut. "Well, boo!" says the ball as it cuts in and strikes low on the back pad in front of the sticks

dismissalText.commentary: Akila Dananjaya c Mulder b Rabada 4 (16b 0x4 0x6 23m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: taken by midwicket running to his right! It is quick. It is short. It cramps the left-hander and even though he tries to make room, he mistimes the shot, a pull that comes off with the bat still turning in his hands. That means he gets no power behind the ball and South Africa are all set to ride out into the sunset

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga c sub (DW Steyn) b Ngidi 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: backs away and swats the short ball outside off straight to the substitute fielder Dale Steyn at cover point. Yep, Dale Steyn's a substitute fielder. And also, South Africa have won, despite putting up only 250 on the board
